en: Oh give thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name; Make known among the peoples his doings.
hmr: Aw, LALPA kuomah lâwmthu hril unla, a hming lam ro; Mi tin lai chun a thilthaw chu inhriettir ro.

en: Sing unto him, sing praises unto him; Talk ye of all his marvellous works.
hmr: Ama chawimawiin hla sak unla, ama inpâkin sak ro; A thilmak thaw po po thu chu titi ro.

en: Glory ye in his holy name: Let the heart of them rejoice that seek Jehovah.
hmr: A hming inthieng chu sawng ro, LALPA zawngtuhai lungril chu hlim raw se.

en: Seek ye Jehovah and his strength; Seek his face evermore.
hmr: LALPA le a hrâtna chu zawng unla, A hmêl chu zawng rawp ro.

en: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done, His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,
hmr: A thilmak thawhai chu hre zing ro, A thilmakhai le a baua a rorêl suokhai chu:

en: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, Ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
hmr: Aw, a siehlaw Abraham thlahai, Jakob thla, a ithlanghai.

en: He is Jehovah our God: His judgments are in all the earth.
hmr: Ama chu LALPA ei Pathien chu a nih, A rorêlhai chu hnuoi chung po poa hin a um.

en: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, The word which he commanded to a thousand generations,
hmr: A thuthlung chu kumkhuoin a hriet hlak a, Suon sâng khat chena a thu lo pêk chu;

en: The covenant which he made with Abraham, And his oath unto Isaac,
hmr: Abraham kuoma a thuthlung le, Isak kuoma a înkhâmna chu.

en: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a statute, To Israel for an everlasting covenant,
hmr: Chu ma chu thuruot ni dingin Jakob kuomah a sukdet a, Israel kuoma kumkhawtluong thuthlung dingin;

en: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, The lot of your inheritance;
hmr: “Kanaan ram hi i kuomah pêng ka ti che, I rochan puol ding chu,” tiin;

en: When they were but a few men in number, Yea, very few, and sojourners in it.
hmr: Mi tlâwmte chau, an ni lai khan, Anih, tlâwmte chau chu rama chun mikhuol an ni nâwk nghâl sih a.

en: And they went about from nation to nation, From one kingdom to another people.
hmr: Hnam tum tum kuomah an fe lawn an fe lawn a, Ram tum tuma inthawkin mi tum tumhai kuomah.

en: He suffered no man to do them wrong; Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
hmr: Tu inêksâwr khawm a phal nawh a, Anih, anni leiin lalhai khawm a kâwk a,

en: Saying, Touch not mine anointed ones, And do my prophets no harm.
hmr: “Ka hriek nâlhai chu tâwk naw unla, Ka zâwlneihai pawi hrim hrim khawm tâwk naw ro,” tiin.

en: And he called for a famine upon the land; He brake the whole staff of bread.
hmr: Chu rama tla dingin ṭâm a ko a, Fâk ding hrim hrim ân um nawtir tah a.

en: He sent a man before them; Joseph was sold for a servant:
hmr: An hmaah mi a tir a, Josef chu siehlaw dinga zawrin a um a,

en: His feet they hurt with fetters: He was laid in chains of iron,
hmr: A kehai chu kawlin an suk- na a, Thîr khaidiet bunin a um tah a.

en: Until the time that his word came to pass, The word of Jehovah tried him.
hmr: A thu a tlung hmakhat chun, LALPA thu chun ama chu a fie hlak a.

en: The king sent and loosed him; Even the ruler of peoples, and let him go free.
hmr: Laltak chun mi a tir a, a sût a, Ân suo tah a, mi tin rorêltu ngei chun.

en: He made him lord of his house, And ruler of all his substance;
hmr: A sûnghai chungah hotua le, A sum po po chunga rorêltuah a siem a;

en: To bind his princes at his pleasure, And teach his elders wisdom.
hmr: A mi lienhai chu a nuom nuoma a khuop ding le, A upahai sukvar dingin.

en: Israel also came into Egypt; And Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
hmr: Israel khawm chu Aigupta ramah a feh a, Jakob ruok chu Ham rama chun a um ta hrih a.

en: And he increased his people greatly, And made them stronger than their adversaries.
hmr: A mihai chu nasatakin a sukpung a, Anni dotuhai nêkin a sukhrât ta lem a.

en: He turned their heart to hate his people, To deal subtly with his servants.
hmr: A mihai theida dingin an lungril ân lêttir a, A siehlawhai chunga vervêktaka thaw dingin.

en: He sent Moses his servant, And Aaron whom he had chosen.
hmr: A siehlaw Mosie chu a tir a, A mi thlang Aron leh.

en: They set among them his signs, And wonders in the land of Ham.
hmr: Anni chun ân chiknahai chu anni lai an inentir a, Ham rama chun thilmakhai an inentir a.

en: He sent darkness, and made it dark; And they rebelled not against his words.
hmr: Ama chun inthim a tir a, a sukthim tah a, Chuongchun, a thuhai chu an sêl ta nawh a.

en: He turned their waters into blood, And slew their fish.
hmr: An tuihai chu thisena ân changtir a, An ngahai chu a sukhlum tah a.

en: Their land swarmed with frogs In the chambers of their kings.
hmr: An ram chu uin a sip tah a, An lalhai pindana chen khawm.

en: He spake, and there came swarms of flies, And lice in all their borders.
hmr: Ama chun thu a hril a; chuongchun, tho tamtak an hung a, Hrik khawm an ram sûng po poah an hung bawk a.

en: He gave them hail for rain, And flaming fire in their land.
hmr: An kuomah ruo aiah riel a pêk a, An rama chun mei chawk zawr zawr a pêk ta bawk a.

en: He smote their vines also and their fig-trees, And brake the trees of their borders.
hmr: An grêp hruihai le an theichang kûnghai a sukhlum a, An rama thinghai chu a sukthliek ta bawk a.

en: He spake, and the locust came, And the grasshopper, and that without number,
hmr: Ama chun thu a hril a; chuong- chun, khâuhai an hung a, Tuktulunghai leh, tiem seng ruollo tawp el hin.

en: And did eat up every herb in their land, And did eat up the fruit of their ground.
hmr: Chuonghai chun an rama thlai tinrênghai chu an fâk zo a, An hnuoi rahai khawm an fâk zo ta bawk a.

en: He smote also all the first-born in their land, The chief of all their strength.
hmr: An rama nau lutîr um po po a sukhlum a, An hrâtna po po ra hmasatakhai chu.

en: And he brought them forth with silver and gold; And there was not one feeble person among his tribes.
hmr: Chuongchun, tangka le râng- kachak leh a ṭhuoi suok a, Ama hnamhai laia chun mi hrât naw pakhat khawm an um dêr nawh.

en: Egypt was glad when they departed; For the fear of them had fallen upon them.
hmr: An suok lai chun Aiguptahai chu an lâwm a, Anni chu an hung ṭî ta leiin.

en: He spread a cloud for a covering, And fire to give light in the night.
hmr: Ama chun hlietu dingin sûm ân zâmtir a, Zâna êntu dingin mei a pêk bawk a.

en: They asked, and he brought quails, And satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
hmr: An hnih a; chuongchun, vamîm a hung ṭhuoi a, Vân buin anni chu a sukkhawp tah a.

en: He opened the rock, and waters gushed out; They ran in the dry places like a river.
hmr: Lungpui chu a hawng a; chuongchun, tui a hung suok zur zur a, Hmun ṭâwlahai chun vadung ang el hin a luong tah a.

en: For he remembered his holy word, And Abraham his servant.
hmr: A thu inthieng kha a hriet zing sih a: A siehlaw Abraham le khan.

en: And he brought forth his people with joy, And his chosen with singing.
hmr: Chuongchun, a mihai chu hlimtakin a ṭhuoi suok tah a, A mi thlanghai chu hla sak pei pumin.

en: And he gave them the lands of the nations; And they took the labor of the peoples in possession:
hmr: Chun,hnam tin ramhai chu an kuomah a pêkpêk a, Anni chun mi tin thaw suoksa chu an hluo tah a;

en: That they might keep his statutes, And observe his laws. Praise ye Jehovah.
hmr: A thuruothai chu an zâwm thei a, A dânhai chu an vawngṭhat theina dingin. LALPA chu inpâk ro.
